name: Customer Data Retention Policy
description: Establishes guidelines for retaining and disposing of customer personal information in compliance with GDPR and CCPA regulations. Defines retention periods for different types of customer data and outlines secure deletion procedures.

name: Data Quality Standards
description: Defines minimum data quality thresholds and validation rules for all enterprise data assets. Includes completeness, accuracy, consistency, and timeliness requirements across all data domains.

name: Financial Data Access Control
description: Controls access to sensitive financial information including revenue, costs, and budget data. Implements role-based access controls and audit logging for all financial data access.

name: Employee Data Privacy Policy
description: Governs the collection, processing, and storage of employee personal information. Ensures compliance with employment law and protects employee privacy rights while enabling necessary HR operations.

name: Data Backup and Recovery
description: Establishes procedures for regular data backups, disaster recovery planning, and business continuity. Defines backup frequencies, retention periods, and recovery time objectives.

name: Third-Party Data Sharing
description: Regulates the sharing of company data with external partners, vendors, and service providers. Includes data sharing agreements, security requirements, and compliance monitoring.

name: AI/ML Data Usage Guidelines
description: Provides guidelines for using company data in artificial intelligence and machine learning models. Addresses data bias, model transparency, and ethical AI practices.

name: Data Classification Framework
description: Defines data classification levels (public, internal, confidential, restricted) and corresponding handling requirements. Establishes labeling standards and access controls for each classification level.

name: Data Lineage Documentation
description: Requires comprehensive documentation of data lineage for all critical data assets. Includes source systems, transformations, and downstream usage tracking.

name: Data Breach Response Protocol
description: Establishes procedures for detecting, reporting, and responding to data breaches. Includes notification requirements, containment procedures, and post-incident analysis.
